name: tin production | tin | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/20003/documentation

This dataset describes the operation of a tin smelter and refinery plant in Peru, The plant has a process capacity of 240 tons concentrate/day and produces around 40,000 tons of refined tin per year (99.95% Sn).  The metallurgical installation consists of a plant where the smelting and reduction processes are carried out in a furnace designed with Ausmelt technology (named Ausmelt furnace).;;The Ausmelt furnace is fed with a metered mixture of tin oxide concentrates, coal, fuel, iron ore, limestone and process recirculating material (slag and drosses). The process uses natural gas which facilitates the retreatment of older, higher grade slags. The mixture of fuel, combustion air and coal are introduced into the furnace, obtaining at the end of each batch raw metallic tin of 99.95% Sn and slag. The combustion gases pass through a cooling system and continue flowing to a system of bag filters for the capture of solid particles that are then returned to the process.;;The process is fed with underground fresh water, 34% of the water is evaporated during the process, 61% is used for the cooling system and 5% is used for irrigation (feed stock and gardens).;The slag is placed on a temporary stockpile located on the plant, and finally is transported to San Rafael mine (located in Puno province) to be used for the underground mining activities as a paste-fill material. 

The process begins with the storage and preparation of the raw materials that are fed to the AUSMELT furnace.

The process ends with the final production and storage of tin ingots (99.95% Sn) inside the refinery installations. The transportation to the final destination of the tin and slag are not included in the modeled system.
category: C:Manufacturing/24:Manufacture of basic metals/243:Casting of metals/2432:Casting of non-ferrous metals

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Information of the last 6 years has been reviewed. During this period there are no significant changes in technology.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The reffered process takes place in the province of Ica located in the south coast of Peru. There is only one tin refinery in Peru.;The slag is transported to San Rafael located in Puno province. San Rafael is a tin mine that holds 100% of tin concentrate production in Peru.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The technology used by the Ausmelt Furnace, for the smelting of tin concentrates, is based on the patent developed by the Commonwealth Scientific and Industrial Research Organization of Australia CSIRO.;The slag is sent to San Rafael mine where  is used for the paste- filling process, therefore the system does not include slag storage and treatment.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The data were collected  from the available information of a refinery company in Peru that holds 100% of the refined tin production according to the Peruvian Ministry of Mine production statistics (2016).

exchanges.description: Refined tin ingot 99.5% Sn, Calculations based on the production reported by the Peruvian Ministry of Energy and mines (2016)
